area_name: Coat of Arms Corner and The Rat Cracks

content.description:
This crack climb follows the water drainage crack that is the first crack to the right of

Crack Sweat

. (Fourth crack system East from the prow)  The first 10' contains the crux with perhaps the hardest move being the first.  Jam a fist crack through a bulge where the climb eases off in difficulty.
content.protection: Rack up to #2 cam.  Bring long slings/ other gear to set up a top anchor.

content.description:
The fourth continuous crack right of

Crack Sweat

.
content.protection: I top-roped it, but there is good placement for trad pro.
content.location: Walk around South Canyon Point to the river bridge crossing.  Take the path up to the left.  Bushwack up left of the bridge and right of the North Canyon point.

climbs.name: Danger Mouse
climbs.fa: [FA of Danger Mouse 1986 Rob Hanson & Lyyn Ankle]

content.description: This route goes up the thin crack to the right of the overhanging prow.  It is right of the off-width sized crack.  This climb is mostly face climbing with the thin crack offering sparse pro.
content.protection: Small pro, mostly nuts and RPs.  Slings/ additional gear to set up TR.

content.description: This route is in the clean, left-facing book corner to the west of the Rat cracks.  The climb is partially hidden from below by some boulders below it.  It is a clean corner with good pro, providing a great moderate lead especially for Castlewood.
content.protection: Standard trad rack up to #2 cam

content.description:
This route goes up the center of the face to the right of

Danger Mouse

.  It starts off with a nice finger crack which ends at a sloping ledge.  After the ledge, it becomes more of a face climb (crux) with some small nut/RP placements in a decent crack.  There may be one last placement before the topping out move after a runout.
content.protection: Finger-sized pieces and some small nuts are all you need.  Long sling/ rope to top rope off juniper tree.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
Coat of Arms Corner and The Rat Cracks
